intro: Sphaeranthus integrifolius, commonly known as the smoothleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, ovate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Sphaeranthus integrifolius is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
